p: BCR-ABL1 IS RQ-PCR was performed using a Molecular MD One-Step qRT-PCR BCR-ABL kit (BML Inc., Kawagoe, Japan). To validate BCR-ABL1 amplification, ABL1 was used as an internal control. A MMR was defined as a 3-log reduction in the BCR-ABL1 transcript according to the international scale ( BCR-ABL1 IS ≤0.1%), MR 4.5 was defined as a 4.5-log reduction in the BCR-ABL1 transcript ( BCR-ABL1 IS ≤0.0032%), and MR 5 was defined as a 5-log reduction in the BCR-ABL1 transcript (BCR-ABL1 IS ≤0.001%), as described above. Undetectable molecular residual disease was defined as undetectable BCR-ABL1 transcript with MR 5 (UMRD with MR 5). At least 100,000 control genes ( ABL1) were required for a sample to be considered as adequate.
